meanings.definition: In a monotonous or dull manner
meanings.sent1: The teacher spoke droningly during the history lesson.
meanings.sent2: She read the story droningly, putting everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The robot repeated the same phrase droningly, causing laughter in the class.
meanings.sent4: The rain fell droningly on the roof, creating a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The clock ticked droningly in the silent room, marking the passing time.

meanings.definition: Speaking or singing in a slow, monotonous tone
meanings.sent1: The droningly song played in the background, lulling everyone to relaxation.
meanings.sent2: His droningly voice made it hard to stay awake during the lecture.
meanings.sent3: The droningly speech by the politician put the audience in a trance.
meanings.sent4: The droningly sound of the fan blended with the quiet of the night.
meanings.sent5: The droningly melody of the flute echoed through the empty hallways.
